ai-ud1.3:1.2_0: At one time, when he was first awakened, the Buddha was staying near Uruvelā at the root of a Bodhi tree on the bank of the river Nerañjara at the foot of a Bodhi tree.
ai-ud1.3:1.3_0: Now at that time the Buddha was sitting cross-legged for seven days without moving, experiencing the bliss of freedom.
ai-ud1.3:1.4_0: When seven days had passed, the Buddha emerged from that state of immersion. In the last part of the night, he reflected on dependent origination in forward and reverse order:
ai-ud1.3:2.1_0: “When this exists, that is; due to the arising of this, that arises. That is:
ai-ud1.3:2.2_0: Due to the arising of this, that arises;
ai-ud1.3:2.3_0: When this doesn’t exist, that is not; due to the cessation of this, that ceases. That is:
ai-ud1.3:2.6_0: ignorance is a condition for choices.
ai-ud1.3:2.8_0: Consciousness is a condition for name and form.
ai-ud1.3:2.9_0: Name and form are conditions for the six sense fields
ai-ud1.3:2.10_0: The six sense fields are conditions for contact.
ai-ud1.3:2.11_0: Contact is a condition for feeling.
ai-ud1.3:2.12_0: Feeling is a condition for craving;
ai-ud1.3:2.13_0: Craving is a condition for grasping.
ai-ud1.3:2.14_0: Grasping is a condition for continued existence.
ai-ud1.3:2.15_0: Continued existence is a condition for rebirth.
ai-ud1.3:2.16_0: Rebirth is a condition for old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress to come to be.
ai-ud1.3:2.17_0: This is how there is the origin of this whole mass of suffering.
ai-ud1.3:3.1_0: When ignorance fades away and ceases with nothing left over, choices cease.
ai-ud1.3:3.3_0: When consciousness ceases name and form cease,
ai-ud1.3:3.5_0: When the six sense fields cease, contact ceases.
ai-ud1.3:3.9_0: when grasping ceases, continued existence ceases.
ai-ud1.3:3.10_0: When continued existence ceases, rebirth ceases.
ai-ud1.3:3.11_0: When rebirth ceases, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress cease.
ai-ud1.3:3.12_0: This is how there is the end of this whole mass of suffering.”
ai-ud1.3:4.1_0: Knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud1.3:5.4_0: Like the sun shining in the sky.”
